intro: Espeletia weddellii, commonly known as the Weddell's heather, is a species of flowering plant native to the high Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, featuring dense, woolly foliage that helps insulate it from cold temperatures. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a range of colors from white to pink. Espeletia weddellii plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
